reviews.review_msg: Humble yet knowledgable prof. He was very enthusiastic in the course material (as it was his thesis topic) and it showed through his enjoyment and involvement. Approachable and friendly, excellent prof.

Maybe it's just me, but I was bored out of my mind. Many classmates skipped class on a regular basis. If you can stay awake, there is a lot to learn. He's a nice guy but lectures aren't all that engaging.

great teacher for upper level courses, you will mature as a student in his class. Approachable and very engaging.  Loves to hear from students. Don't be alarmed by the lack of schedule, he makes university what its supposed to be. Enjoy his passion for lit, you wont find anyone like him.

I took this class as an elective, having only taken 1 other post-secondary English course (ENGL 111W), I was a bit concerned, but Carolyn was very helpful and gave great feedback. Lectures were async, which was nice. Overall an enjoyable class. Thanks Carolyn.

Carolyn is amazing! While I agree the 1000 page book was a bit much, she did take our complaints seriously and I think she may change this in the future. She's warm and friendly and super-freaking smart. She will help you as much as you need her to with your papers, and she genuinely wants you to do well... and LEARN! Do not miss out on this prof!

She's unreasonable.  Who assigns a 1000 page novel in the middle of a semester where midterms are likeliest?  She doesn't stick to her own outline, has little respect for class end times (we rarely get breaks and classes always seem to end at 11:30 not 11:20 as they should).

Great prof! Take her courses she's the best at what she does and is a lot of fun. She's kind and extremely positive and is very flexible. Lots of xtra reading material, but interesting stuff. Movies in class, long presentations, serious marker (make sure ur essays are in tip top shape-send her ur thesis if ur not sure). A really wonderful person.

Kandice was a really good prof. She tries to keep you interested in the material by having extra activities in class. Really nice and super understanding. Lets the class be super casual. She does not give clear instructions for assignments but if you email her she will explain everything. Fair marker.

This prof is great! If you do the readings, participate in class once and a while, and do the assigned work, you will do well. Lectures can be a bit slow at times but she is caring and helpful. I'd recommend her classes but be ready to write proper English papers and do the readings.

First of all, Margaret is an insanely caring prof who wants to see her students succeed. She was very accessible when I reached out to her outside of class and she had very clear marking criteria. The readings were heavy at times, but expected for an upper div course. Overall, Margaret is a great prof and if you put in the effort you will do great!

She's nice and passionate about what she teaches. The lectures were a bit boring at times, but that did not stop the class from being engaged in learning. She knows a ton about Victorian literature, and the final paper was the paper I enjoyed writing the most in my university years.
This prof is amazing. I highly recommend taking her 19c lit classes.
